content:
Implement a 100-bit register to store the current state of the rotator. This register should be loaded with the input data when the load signal is high, otherwise it should maintain its state or update based on the rotation direction specified by ena.

Retrieved Related Information:
- clk: Clock input (Type:Signal)
- load: Load signal, loads shift register with data[99:0] when high (Type:Signal)
- ena: 2-bit enable signal, controls the direction of rotation (Type:Signal)
- data: 100-bit input data (Type:Signal)
- q: 100-bit output data, contents of the rotator (Type:Signal)
- (1) load: Loads shift register with data[99:0] instead of rotating. Synchronous active high. (Type:StateTransition)
- (2) ena[1:0]: Synchronous. Chooses whether and which direction to rotate: (Type:StateTransition)
  - (a) 2'b01 rotates right by one bit, (Type:StateTransition)
  - (b) 2'b10 rotates left by one bit, (Type:StateTransition)
  - (c) 2'b00 and 2'b11 do not rotate. (Type:StateTransition)
source: load: Loads shift register with data[99:0] instead of rotating. Synchronous active high.

content:
Implement the logic to rotate the bits in the register to the right by one position when ena is set to 2'b01. This involves taking the LSB of the register and making it the MSB while shifting all other bits to the right by one position.

Retrieved Related Information:

(a) 2'b01 rotates right by one bit.
